title: Squirrel on a wire part - c

content.description: A squirrel starts at building A at time t=0 and travels along a straight,horizontal wire connected to building B. For 0≤t≤18 , the squirrel's velocity is modeled by the piecewise-linear function defined by the graph above.
content.question: Find the total distance the squirrel travels during the time interval 0≤t≤18.

frqParts.text: Find the total distance the squirrel travels during the time interval 0≤t≤18.

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
